metadata.name: Language and Style (Children's Stories Expansion)
metadata.description: Language patterns and stylistic elements for children's fairy tales

opening_formulas.text: Begin with a child protagonist facing a small, relatable problem
Start with a question that directly addresses the young reader
Open with a whimsical description of an ordinary setting made magical
Introduce a talking animal character who befriends a lonely child
Begin with a child discovering something unusual in a familiar place

sensory_language.text: Describe foods with exaggerated deliciousness and magical properties
Use onomatopoeia for animal sounds, weather, and magical effects
Include tactile descriptions that children can imagine feeling
Create vivid color descriptions using similes from a child's experience
Describe smells that trigger curiosity or comfort

dialogue_patterns.text: Include repeated phrases that children can anticipate and join in with
Create distinct speech patterns for different character types
Use simple but clever wordplay in character conversations
Include misunderstandings that young readers can recognize before characters do
Write dialogue that alternates between humor and gentle life lessons

emotional_scaffolding.text: Name feelings explicitly to help children identify emotions
Show characters working through fears with simple coping strategies
Include moments of wonder that pause the narrative for appreciation
Create safe moments of tension that resolve quickly and reassuringly
Show friendship forming through small acts of kindness

magical_logic.text: Establish simple, consistent rules for how magic works in the story
Connect magical elements to natural phenomena children understand
Create magical consequences that teach gentle lessons
Include magical helpers with specific limitations or conditions
Show magic responding to kindness, honesty, or creativity

rhythm_and_sound.text: Create sentences with bouncy, singable rhythms for exciting moments
Use shorter sentences for action and longer ones for description
Include rhyming elements for magical spells or special moments
Repeat sounds within sentences to create memorable phrases
Vary sentence beginnings to maintain young listeners' attention

resolution_patterns.text: Resolve conflicts through cooperation rather than defeating villains
Include a moment of recognition where the protagonist realizes a truth
Show characters returning home changed but comforted
End with a small, achievable act of bravery or kindness
Close with a gentle question or invitation for the reader to imagine beyond the ending
